reviewText: this is the classic batman anime. it's just a few short episodes....that iclude catwoman. but seeing batman's 1st reaction in the series to catwoman is downright funny. so....if u can find it cheap and are not looking for the ENTIRE series like i was......it's an awesome buy.

reviewText: Ok, once again warner bros. is trying to get a little cash, by once again releasing a 4 episode set, compared to a 28 episode set. I would normally give all Batman DVDs a 5-star review, but this I cannot. This set contains four episodes....get ready for this....that have already been released on dvd in july!!! Sure it was released in a box set, and for only approximately $35.00 Compared to this $15 dollar set for 4 dollars, the box set is  a VERY good deal. Appeasing kids for an hour is a good idea but for the pricing just go rent a dvd. Trust me, you'd be much better buying the box set for only 20 dollars more. But in case you're still wanting to get this dvd, it contains 4 eps. They include: a 2 parter w/ catwoman, an ep. w/ mr. freeze, and an ep. w/ an invisible foe. but believe me, the box set is way cooler (price and design and well, everything wise)

reviewerName: morgoth "we lamas are traditional enemies of ...
reviewText: So I think that this was the last of these stupid four episode dvd's.  Thank god I have every episode and don't have to go to bestbuy once a week to... I will seriously go on forever.HEART OF ICE-Possibly my favorite episode, I am still undecided between the one where bruce wayne has to commit suicide to save his life, you love the irony and you know, so if you have never seen this show this would actually be a perfect disc to pick up at the local used store so you can decide if you wwant all the episodes of one of the greatest television show cartoon or not.  This one REALLY makes you fell for mr freeze and the directors are so freaking brilliant with the storyline with this one that you would think that they would be making huge jack for the top shows or movies or something.  I don't want to give anything away but be prepared for one of the best 30 min.(22) shows of all time.CAT AND THE CLAW-  This is a 2 parter that introduces catwoman, the story is not one of the stronger ones but is still above average even for this series.  This also has a top ten line for me where batman tells a sickened catwoman(unmasked) that she is hot(while feeling her forhead).  And selina(catwoman) says "now you notice" right as she oasses out.  This show had a couple of stronger sexual parts in the series, but they were extremely random. This quote from THE MAN WHO KILLED BATMAN.  Harley shows up to bail the man who killed... out of jail and the fat dirty cop bullock says "don't I know you from somewhere", and harley looking really hot(for a cartoon, she was not dressed as a clown) says "I believe I served you a subpoena once" then turns back around and fires again with "I believe it's a small subpeona".  Freaking classic batman.SEE NO EVIL- Easily the second creepiest episode ever for batman.  The one where the mayor's son seeks to find and does joker's hideout is the best.  Thsi is one where a guy is using a suit that he helped develop that can make you invisible.  Sounds corny right, well not when you add in teh fact that he is using the suit for crimes of course but also to visit his daughter who lives with her mom because of their seperation.  This one still frightens me a little bit watching it like 12 years after I first saw it, and you honestly believe that batman has a chance of losing this.  Great stuff.
summary: yet another crappy dvd with 2 of the best episodes in the series, a must have if you like the show but can't afford the sets
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Batman - The Animated Series - Secrets of the Caped Crusader" contains episodes 14 to 17. These contain some of the best episodes of the show, where Batman comes across villains such as Mr. Freeze and Catwoman.The episodes in this DVD are:14) Heart of Ice - An evildoer is stealing equipment from various GothCorp facilities and using a freezing gun to freeze anyone who comes in his way. Batman uses the clues and discovers the next area where the attacker may appear, and finds out that Mr. Freeze is behind all this. Freeze escapes from Batman, but doesn't plan on killing him since his main intention is revenge on Ferris Boyle, CEO of GothCorp. Batman tries to find out what is the reason for Freeze's doings, to stop him.This is the first episode to have Mr. Freeze in it, and it is a terrific episode. You really feel sorry for Victor Fries, but at the same time hatred for Mr. Freeze. The way in which Batman tries to capture Freeze is entertaining. (5/5)15 & 16) The Cat and the Claw Parts I and II - There is a new cat burglar in Gotham, and Batman finds out that it is a woman. The two of them form a relationship, but Batman loses her. Meanwhile, there is a new terrorist in town by the name of Red Claw whom Batman is looking for as well. Red Claw is after a plague that she wants for her mission. Later, Bruce Wayne also falls for Celina Kyle, a wildlife activist who is trying to buy land for a wildlife preserve, but has to fight with MutiGon Corp. (who is planning on building a resort there). Can Batman fight his feelings for Catwoman and Celina Kyle by going after her? Will they be able to stop Red Claw from destroying Gotham?This is one of my favorite episodes. The chemistry between Bruce Wayne/Batman and Celina Kyle/Catwoman is great to watch. The storyline was very intriguing, where Batman had to face fighting two women. (5/5)17) See No Evil - This episode starts off with an invisible man walking through the window to see a young girl called Kimberly. The girl refers to him as Mojo, and is happy that he brought her a necklace. However, she is sad that she will not see him again because they are planning to move. Now, the invisible man, Lloyd Ventrix makes sure that his daughter Kimmy is not taken away from him. He steals jewelry from a Jewelry Store (when Bruce Wayne is also present there) and later sells them to make money. Will Batman be able to catch the crook, considering that he can't even see him?I really liked this episode because we see how Batman faces an enemy whom he cannot see. The way in which he tries to fight Lloyd is very interesting. (5/5).This was probably the last DVD that WB decided to release separately as a separate 4 episode DVD. Since most of the people are buying the series in its entire volumes, it is rather pointless in buying these separate 4-episode DVDS. However, if you are a huge fan of the show and collect all the merchandise, then you can add this to your collection, otherwise buy the 3 Volumes of the show.
summary: 5 stars only for the amazing episodes!
